intro: Sisymbrium wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan tansy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Sisymbrium wallichii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
